Package com.koverse.sdk.annotation

Annotations used to describe Koverse extensible components.

See: Description

  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    Description
    Describes an extensible component of Koverse.
    EnumParameter
    Describes an enumeration parameter for an extensible Koverse component.
    StringParameter
    Describes a string (text) parameter for an extensible Koverse component.

Package com.koverse.sdk.annotation Description

Annotations used to describe Koverse extensible components. Currently, only field maskers support these annotations. In the future, thee annotations will be also be used for other extensible components like sources, transforms, sinks, etc.

Here is an example of how to use these annotations. It is field masker that performs SHA hashing on the field values: 

 
 
 import com.koverse.sdk.annotation.EnumParameter
 import com.koverse.sdk.annotation.StringParameter
 
 import java.nio.charset.Charset;
 import java.security.MessageDigest;
 import java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException;
 import java.util.Base64;
 import com.koverse.sdk.annotation.Description;
 
 @Description(
   id = "sha-hash-masker", 
   name = "SHA Hasher", 
   description = "Does SHA hashing", 
   majorVersion = 1, 
   minorVersion = 0, 
   patchVersion = 1)
 public class ShaFieldMasker implements FieldMasker {
   private final Charset UTF8 = Charset.forName("UTF-8");
   
   @EnumParameter(
     id = "type", 
     name = "Hash Type",
     groupName = "", 
     required = true, 
     description = "Choose a hash type",
     values = {"SHA-1", "SHA-256", "SHA-512"},
     defaultValue = "SHA-1")
     private String type;
 
    @StringParameter(
     id = "salt", 
     name = "Hash Salt", 
     groupName = "", 
     required = false, 
     description = "Salts the hash", 
     hideInput = true,
     defaultValue = "")
   private String salt;
 
   @Override
   public Object mask(final Object o) {
     try {
       final String input = o.toString() + salt;
       final MessageDigest messageDigest = MessageDigest.getInstance(type);
       final byte[] digest = messageDigest.digest(input.getBytes(UTF8));
 
       return Base64.getEncoder().encodeToString(digest);
     } catch (NoSuchAlgorithmException e) {
       throw new RuntimeException("Hash Type not found", e);
     }
   }
 }
